intro: Pedicularis densispica var. schneideri, commonly known as the Schneider's beard vetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its dense, spiculate hairs covering its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces showy, spurred flowers in shades of red and orange, typically during the summer months. This variant is known for its adaptability to high-altitude environments and its ecological importance in alpine ecosystems.
